Class Vault

  • java.lang.Object
    • Vault

  • public class Vault
extends java.lang.Object
    Java API for Hashicorp's Vault project. A tool for managing secrets.
    See Also:
    https://vaultproject.io/

    • Nested Class Summary

    • Constructor Detail

      • Vault

        public Vault(java.lang.String vaultServer,
             java.lang.String vaultToken)
        Initialize Vault
        Parameters:
        vaultServer - http address to vault server, example: http://127.0.0.1:8200
        vaultToken - vault token used to authenticate requests

      • Vault

        public Vault(java.lang.String vaultServer,
             java.lang.String vaultToken,
             javax.ws.rs.client.Client client)
        Initialize Vault with custom Jersey HTTP client, for fine tuning and proxy configurations
        Parameters:
        vaultServer - http address to vault server, example: http://127.0.0.1:8200
        vaultToken - vault token used to authenticate requests
        client - custom Jersey client

    • Method Detail

      • read

        public VaultResponse read(java.lang.String path)
        Read value from vault
        Parameters:
        path - the vault path where secret is stored
        Returns:
        the response object containing your secret
        Throws:
        VaultException - if API returns anything except 200

      • write

        public void write(java.lang.String path,
                  java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,java.lang.String> secret)
        Write key/value secret to vault
        Parameters:
        path - where to write secret
        secret - A key, paired with an associated value, to be held at the given location. Multiple key/value pairs can be specified, and all will be returned on a read operation. The generic backend use 'value' as key
        Throws:
        VaultException - if operation fails

      • delete

        public void delete(java.lang.String path)
        Delete path from vault
        Parameters:
        path - to be deleted
        Throws:
        VaultException - containing error reason

      • getStatus

        public Vault.Status getStatus()
        Get seal status from Vault
        Returns:
        Status containing shares, progress, shards and seal status
        Throws:
        VaultException - on non 200 status codes
